intro: Psychotria manampanihensis, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine by local communities. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
